slokas.sanskrit:
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच
धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः | मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ||
slokas.pronunciation:
dhr̥taraṣṭra uvāca
dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ
māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāś caiva kim akurvata sañjaya
slokas.meaning: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, gathered in the holy land of Kurukshetra, and eager to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?

slokas.sanskrit:
सञ्जय उवाच
दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा | आचार्यमुपसंगम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
sañjaya uvāca
dr̥ṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavānīkaṁ vyūḍhaṁ duryodhanas tadā
ācāryam upasaṅgamya rājā vacanam abravīt
slokas.meaning: Sanjaya said: On observing the Pandava army arranged in military formation, King Duryodhana approached his teacher Dronacharya and said these words.

slokas.sanskrit: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् | व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता ||
slokas.pronunciation:
paśyaitāṁ pāṇḍu-putrāṇām ācārya mahatīṁ camūm
vyūḍhāṁ drupada-putreṇa tava śiṣyeṇa dhīmatā
slokas.meaning: Behold, O Teacher, this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, organized skillfully by your gifted disciple, the son of Drupada.

slokas.sanskrit: अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि | युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
atra śūrā maheṣvāsā bhīmārjuna-samā yudhi
yuyudhāno virāṭaś ca drupadaś ca mahārathaḥ
slokas.meaning: Here in this army are heroic bowmen, equal in battle to Bhima and Arjuna: Yuyudhana, Virata, and Drupada, the mighty warrior.

slokas.sanskrit: धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान् | पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
dhṛṣṭaketuś cekitānaḥ kāśirājaś ca vīryavān
purujit kuntibhojaś ca śaibyaś ca nara-puṅgavaḥ
slokas.meaning: There are also courageous warriors like Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, the valiant King of Kasi, Purujit, Kuntibhoja, and Shaibya, the best among men.

slokas.sanskrit: युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान् | सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yudhāmanyuś ca vikrānta uttamaujāś ca vīryavān
saubhadro draupadeyāś ca sarva eva mahārathāḥ
slokas.meaning: The mighty Yudhamanyu, the valiant Uttamauja, Abhimanyu (the son of Subhadra), and the sons of Draupadi—all great warriors.

slokas.sanskrit: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम | नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते ||
slokas.pronunciation:
asmākaṁ tu viśiṣṭā ye tān nibodha dvijottama
nāyakā mama sainyasya sañjñārthaṁ tān bravīmi te
slokas.meaning: O best of Brahmins, let me now describe to you the notable warriors in my army, for your information.

slokas.sanskrit: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिंजयः | अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च ||
slokas.pronunciation:
bhavān bhīṣmaś ca karṇaś ca kr̥paś ca samitiṁ-jayaḥ
aśvatthāmā vikarṇaś ca saumadattis tathaiva ca
slokas.meaning: Yourself, Bhishma, Karna, Kripa who are always victorious in battle; Ashwatthama, Vikarna, and also Bhurishrava, the son of Somadatta.

slokas.sanskrit: अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः | नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
anye ca bahavaḥ śūrā mad-arthe tyakta-jīvitāḥ
nānā-śastra-praharaṇāḥ sarve yuddha-viśāradāḥ
slokas.meaning: Many other brave warriors are also prepared to lay down their lives for my sake, all armed with various weapons and well-versed in the art of war.

slokas.sanskrit: अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् | पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
aparyāptaṁ tad asmākaṁ balaṁ bhīṣmābhirakṣitam
paryāptaṁ tv idam eteṣāṁ balaṁ bhīmābhirakṣitam
slokas.meaning: The strength of our army, protected by Bhishma, is unlimited, whereas the strength of the Pandavas, protected by Bhima, is limited.

slokas.sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिताः | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि ||
slokas.pronunciation:
ayaneṣu ca sarveṣu yathābhāgam avasthitāḥ
bhīṣmam evābhirakṣantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi
slokas.meaning: Therefore, all of you, stationed at your respective positions, should protect Bhishma from all sides.

slokas.sanskrit: तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः | सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चैः शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
tasya sañjanayan harṣaṁ kuru-vṛddhaḥ pitāmahaḥ
siṁhanādaṁ vinadyoccaiḥ śaṅkhaṁ dadhmau pratāpavān
slokas.meaning: Then, the grand old man of the Kuru dynasty, Bhishma, roared like a lion and blew his conch shell to encourage Duryodhana.

slokas.sanskrit: ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः | सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
tataḥ śaṅkhāś ca bheryaś ca paṇavānaka-gomukhāḥ
sahasaivābhyahanyanta sa śabdas tumulo 'bhavat
slokas.meaning: Thereafter, conch shells, drums, bugles, trumpets, and horns were sounded simultaneously, and the combined sound was tumultuous.

slokas.sanskrit: ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ | माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
tataḥ śvetair hayair yukte mahati syandane sthitau
mādhavaḥ pāṇḍavaś caiva divyau śaṅkhau pradadhmatuḥ
slokas.meaning: Then, seated in a glorious chariot drawn by white horses, Madhava (Krishna) and the son of Pandu (Arjuna) blew their celestial conch shells.

slokas.sanskrit: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः | पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
pāñcajanyaṁ hṛṣīkeśo devadattaṁ dhanañjayaḥ
pauṇḍraṁ dadhmau mahāśaṅkhaṁ bhīma-karmā vṛkodaraḥ
slokas.meaning: Hrishikesha (Krishna) blew his conch named Panchajanya, and Arjuna blew his conch named Devadatta. Bhima, the performer of mighty deeds, blew his great conch named Paundra.

slokas.sanskrit: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः | नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ ||
slokas.pronunciation:
anantavijayaṁ rājā kuntīputro yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
nakulaḥ sahadevaś ca sughoṣa-maṇipuṣpakau
slokas.meaning: King Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, blew his conch named Anantavijaya. Nakula and Sahadeva blew their conches named Sughosha and Manipushpaka.

slokas.sanskrit: काश्यश्च परमेष्वासः शिखण्डी च महारथः | धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजितः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
kāśyaś ca parameṣvāsaḥ śikhaṇḍī ca mahārathaḥ
dhṛṣṭadyumno virāṭaś ca sātyakiś cāparājitaḥ
slokas.meaning: The great archer, the king of Kashi, the great chariot-warrior Shikhandi, Dhrishtadyumna, Virata, and the unvanquished Satyaki.

slokas.sanskrit: द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वशः पृथिवीपते | सौभद्रश्च महाबाहुः शङ्खान्दध्मुः पृथक् पृथक् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
drupado draupadeyāś ca sarvaśaḥ pṛthivīpate
saubhadraś ca mahābāhuḥ śaṅkhān dadhmuḥ pṛthak pṛthak
slokas.meaning: O Lord of the Earth, Drupada, the sons of Draupadi and the mighty-armed son of Subhadra, all blew their respective conches.

slokas.sanskrit: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् | नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलो व्यनुनादयन् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
sa ghoṣo dhārtarāṣṭrāṇāṁ hṛdayāni vyadārayat
abhaś ca pṛthivīṁ caiva tumulo vyanunādayan
slokas.meaning: That tumultuous sound echoed through heaven and earth, piercing the hearts of Dhritarashtra's sons.

slokas.sanskrit: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान् कपिध्वजः | प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
atha vyavasthitān dṛṣṭvā dhārtarāṣṭrān kapidhvajaḥ
pravṛtte śastrasampāte dhanurudyamya pāṇḍavaḥ
slokas.meaning: Then, seeing the sons of Dhritarashtra standing arrayed and the discharge of weapons about to begin, Arjuna, who had the flag of Hanuman on his chariot, took up his bow.

slokas.sanskrit:
हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते | अर्जुन उवाच
सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत ||
slokas.pronunciation:
hṛṣīkeśaṁ tadā vākyam idam āha mahīpate
arjuna uvāca
senayor ubhayor madhye rathaṁ sthāpaya me 'cyuta
slokas.meaning: O King, Arjuna then spoke these words to Krishna: O Achyuta (Krishna), please draw my chariot between the two armies.

slokas.sanskrit: यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान् | कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन् रणसमुद्यमे ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yāvad etān nirīkṣe 'haṁ yoddhu-kāmān avasthitān
kair mayā saha yoddhavyam asmin raṇa-samudyame
slokas.meaning: So that I may observe those who stand here desirous of fighting, and know with whom I must fight in this battle.

slokas.sanskrit: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः | धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षवः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yotsyamānān avekṣe 'haṁ ya ete 'tra samāgatāḥ
dhārtarāṣṭrasya durbuddher yuddhe priya-cikīrṣavaḥ
slokas.meaning: Let me see those who have come here to fight, wishing to please the evil-minded son of Dhritarashtra.

slokas.sanskrit:
सञ्जय उवाच
एवं वाक्यार्जुनेनोक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेश | सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
sañjaya uvāca
evaṁ vākyārjunenoktaḥ hṛṣīkeśo guḍākeśaḥ
senayor ubhayor madhye sthāpayitvā rathottamam
slokas.meaning: Sanjaya said: O King, thus addressed by Arjuna, Krishna drew the magnificent chariot between the two armies.

slokas.sanskrit: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् | उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति ||
slokas.pronunciation:
bhīṣma-droṇa-pramukhataḥ sarveṣāṁ ca mahīkṣitām
uvāca pārtha paśyaitān samavetān kurūn iti
slokas.meaning: In front of Bhishma, Drona and all the rulers of the earth, Krishna said: O Partha (Arjuna), behold these assembled Kurus.

slokas.sanskrit: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितॄनथ पितामहान् | आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातॄन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा ||
slokas.pronunciation:
tatrāpaśyat sthitān pārthaḥ pitṝn atha pitāmahān
ācāryān mātulān bhrātṝn putrān pautrān sakhīṁs tathā
slokas.meaning: There Arjuna saw standing fathers, grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons and friends.

slokas.sanskrit: श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि | तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
śvaśurān suhṛdaś caiva senayor ubhayor api
tān samīkṣya sa kaunteyaḥ sarvān bandhūn avasthitān
slokas.meaning: Fathers-in-law, friends and all his well-wishers standing in both armies. When the son of Kunti saw all these relatives present there.

slokas.sanskrit:
कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् | अर्जुन उवाच
दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
kṛpayā parayāviṣṭo viṣīdann idam abravīt
arjuna uvāca
dṛṣṭvemaṁ svajanaṁ kṛṣṇa yuyutsuṁ samupasthitam
slokas.meaning: Filled with great compassion, Arjuna spoke these words in sorrow: O Krishna, seeing these kinsmen assembled here desirous to fight.

slokas.sanskrit: सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति | वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते ||
slokas.pronunciation:
sīdanti mama gātrāṇi mukhaṁ ca pariśuṣyati
vepathuś ca śarīre me roma-harṣaś ca jāyate
slokas.meaning: My limbs quiver and my mouth becomes dry. My whole body trembles and my hair stands on end.

slokas.sanskrit: गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्चैव परिदह्यते | न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
gāṇḍīvaṁ sraṁsate hastāt tvak caiva paridahyate
na ca śaknomy avasthātuṁ bhramatīva ca me manaḥ
slokas.meaning: The Gandiva (bow) slips from my hands and my skin burns all over. I am unable to stand steady and my mind seems to be reeling.

slokas.sanskrit: निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव | न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ||
slokas.pronunciation:
nimittāni ca paśyāmi viparītāni keśava
na ca śreyo 'nupaśyāmi hatvā svajanam āhave
slokas.meaning: O Keshava, I see adverse omens. I do not foresee any good in killing my own kinsmen in this battle.

slokas.sanskrit: न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च | किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा ||
slokas.pronunciation:
na kāṅkṣe vijayaṁ kṛṣṇa na ca rājyaṁ sukhāni ca
kiṁ no rājyena govinda kiṁ bhogair jīvitena vā
slokas.meaning: O Krishna, I do not desire victory, kingdom or pleasures. O Govinda, what is the use of a kingdom, enjoyments, or even life?

slokas.sanskrit: येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च | त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yeṣām arthe kāṅkṣitaṁ no rājyaṁ bhogāḥ sukhāni ca
ta ime 'vasthitā yuddhe prāṇāṁs tyaktvā dhanāni ca
slokas.meaning: Those for whose sake we desire kingdom, enjoyments and pleasures, stand here in battle, giving up their lives and wealth.

slokas.sanskrit: आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः | मातुलाः श्वशुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा ||
slokas.pronunciation:
ācāryāḥ pitaraḥ putrās tathaiva ca pitāmahāḥ
mātulāḥ śvaśurāḥ pautrāḥ śyālāḥ sambandhinas tathā
slokas.meaning: Teachers, fathers, sons and grandfathers, maternal uncles, fathers-in-law, grandsons, brothers-in-law and other relatives.

slokas.sanskrit: एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन | अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते ||
slokas.pronunciation:
etān na hantum icchāmi ghnato 'pi madhusūdana
api trailokya-rājyasya hetoḥ kiṁ nu mahī-kṛte
slokas.meaning: O Madhusudana, I do not wish to kill them, even if they kill me, even for the kingdom of the three worlds, let alone for this earthly kingdom.

slokas.sanskrit: निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्जनार्दन | पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिनः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
nihatya dhārtarāṣṭrān naḥ kā prītiḥ syāj janārdana
pāpam evāśrayed asmān hatvaitān ātatāyinaḥ
slokas.meaning: O Janardana, what pleasure will we derive from killing the sons of Dhritarashtra? Sin alone will overcome us if we slay these aggressors.

slokas.sanskrit: तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्स्वबान्धवान् | स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव ||
slokas.pronunciation:
tasmān nārhā vayaṁ hantuṁ dhārtarāṣṭrān sa-bāndhavān
svajanaṁ hi kathaṁ hatvā sukhinaḥ syāma mādhava
slokas.meaning: Therefore, we should not kill our own kinsmen, the sons of Dhritarashtra. O Madhava, how can we be happy by killing our own people?

slokas.sanskrit: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः | कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yady apy ete na paśyanti lobhopahata-cetasaḥ
kula-kṣaya-kṛtaṁ doṣaṁ mitra-drohe ca pātakam
slokas.meaning: Although these men, with intelligence overcome by greed, see no evil in destroying families and committing crimes against friends.

slokas.sanskrit: कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम् | कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन ||
slokas.pronunciation:
kathaṁ na jñeyam asmābhiḥ pāpād asmān nivartitum
kula-kṣaya-kṛtaṁ doṣaṁ prapaśyadbhir janārdana
slokas.meaning: O Janardana, why should we not know to turn away from this sin, seeing the evils of destroying the family?

slokas.sanskrit: कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः | धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत ||
slokas.pronunciation:
kula-kṣaye praṇaśyanti kula-dharmāḥ sanātanāḥ
dharme naṣṭe kulaṁ kṛtsnam adharmo 'bhibhavaty uta
slokas.meaning: With the destruction of the family, the eternal family traditions perish. When dharma is lost, the entire family is overcome by adharma.

slokas.sanskrit: अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः | स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
adharmābhibhavāt kṛṣṇa praduṣyanti kula-striyaḥ
strīṣu duṣṭāsu vārṣṇeya jāyate varṇa-saṅkaraḥ
slokas.meaning: O Krishna, when adharma prevails, the women of the family become corrupted. When women become corrupted, O descendant of Vrishni, it leads to unwanted progeny.

slokas.sanskrit: सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्नानां कुलस्य च | पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
saṅkaro narakāyaiva kula-ghnānāṁ kulasya ca
patanti pitaro hy eṣāṁ lupta-piṇḍodaka-kriyāḥ
slokas.meaning: An increase in unwanted population leads to a hellish situation for both the family and those who destroy the family tradition. The ancestors fall because the offerings of food and water are discontinued.

slokas.sanskrit: दोषैरेतैः कुलघ्नानां वर्णसङ्करकारकैः | उत्साद्यन्ते जातिधर्माः कुलधर्माश्च शाश्वताः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
doṣair etaiḥ kula-ghnānāṁ varṇa-saṅkara-kārakaiḥ
utsādyante jāti-dharmāḥ kula-dharmāś ca śāśvatāḥ
slokas.meaning: By the evil deeds of those who destroy the family tradition and thus give rise to unwanted children, all kinds of community projects and family welfare activities are devastated.

slokas.sanskrit: उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन | नरके नियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुशुश्रुम ||
slokas.pronunciation:
utsanna-kula-dharmāṇāṁ manuṣyāṇāṁ janārdana
narake niyataṁ vāso bhavatīty anuśuśruma
slokas.meaning: O Janardana, I have heard that those whose family traditions are destroyed dwell always in hell.

slokas.sanskrit: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् | यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यताः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
aho bata mahat-pāpaṁ kartuṁ vyavasitā vayam
yad rājya-sukha-lobhena hantuṁ svajanam udyatāḥ
slokas.meaning: Alas, how strange it is that we are preparing to commit greatly sinful acts, driven by the desire to enjoy royal happiness, we are intent on killing our own kinsmen.

slokas.sanskrit: यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः | धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yadi mām apratīkāram aśastraṁ śastra-pāṇayaḥ
dhārtarāṣṭrā raṇe hanyus tan me kṣemataraṁ bhavet
slokas.meaning: I would consider it better for the sons of Dhritarashtra to kill me unarmed and unresisting, rather than fight with them.

slokas.sanskrit:
सञ्जय उवाच
एवमुक्त्वार्जुनः संख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् | विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्नमानसः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
sañjaya uvāca
evam uktvārjunaḥ saṅkhye rathopastha upāviśat
visṛjya sa-śaraṁ cāpaṁ śoka-saṁvigna-mānasaḥ
slokas.meaning: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus in the midst of the battlefield, Arjuna cast aside his bow and arrows and sat down on the chariot, his mind overwhelmed with grief.
